original_solution_mapping.L1: Lee currently earns $60,000 / 12 months = $<<60000/12=5000>>5,000 per month.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The engagement ring will cost him 2 * $5,000 = $<<2*5000=10000>>10,000.
original_solution_mapping.L3: This means that it will take Lee $10,000 / $1,000 = <<10000/1000=10>>10 months to save enough money before he can propose.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5345.
    Returns: the number of months it will take Lee to save enough money for the ring.
    """
    # L1
    annual_salary = 60000 # $60,000 per year in salary
    months_per_year = 12 # WK
    monthly_salary = annual_salary / months_per_year

    # L2
    months_salary_for_ring = 2 # two months' salary
    ring_cost = months_salary_for_ring * monthly_salary

    # L3
    monthly_savings = 1000 # can save $1000 per month
    time_to_save_months = ring_cost / monthly_savings

    # FA
    answer = time_to_save_months
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Lee currently earns ${annual_salary} / {months_per_year} months = $<<{annual_salary}/{months_per_year}={monthly_salary}>>{monthly_salary} per month.
The engagement ring will cost him {months_salary_for_ring} * ${monthly_salary} = $<<{months_salary_for_ring}*{monthly_salary}={ring_cost}>>{ring_cost}.
This means that it will take Lee ${ring_cost} / ${monthly_savings} = <<{ring_cost}/{monthly_savings}={time_to_save_months}>>{time_to_save_months} months to save enough money before he can propose.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Lee currently earns $60000 / 12 months = $<<60000/12=5000>>5000 per month.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: The engagement ring will cost him 2 * $5000 = $<<2*5000=10000>>10000.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: This means that it will take Lee $60000 / $1000 = <<60000/1000=60>>60 months to save enough money before he can propose.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'annual_salary' (value: 60000) was used instead of 'ring_cost' (value: 10000.0).
